intro: Amsinckia communis, commonly known as the common stickseed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its seed pods are distinctive for their elongated, segmented appearance. Amsinckia communis is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
